column4: I doubt I will get help for my problem here, considering I asked a different channel that was also related and they simply told me to figure it out myself.

I hope I don't offend anyone here, but I'm in the process of switching from Ubuntu to another distro, because I want to see which one I like better. My only concern is that when I overwrite Ubuntu, it will nuke GRUB and I'll be unable to boot anything (its a dual-boot system with windows).
why don't you just install fedora alongside ubuntu?  Or try it in a vm?
